thread.title: Freight train derails, careens into roadway
thread.title_full: Freight train derails, careens into roadway | New York Post

author: Danielle Furfaro
title: Freight train derails, careens into roadway
text:
New Windsor FD (Orange) City of Newburgh FD Train derailment River Rd Photos ~ Anonymous 
A post shared by Kempter's Fire Wire (Official) (@kempterfirewire) on Mar 7, 2017 at 12:44pm PST 
A CSX freight train carrying hazardous materials derailed in the city of Newburgh Tuesday afternoon, with the locomotive careening into a nearby roadway, cops said.
The train, which was running southbound through the city, jumped the track just after 3 pm and flew across Water Street.
The train was carrying hazardous materials, including sulfuric acid and sodium hydroxide, as well as more benign cargo such as corn oil and glass products, said CSX spokesman Rob Doolittle. None of the cargo spilled, but diesel is leaking from the locomotive, according to Doolittle.
Emergency services are at the scene cleaning up the mess and fuel, cops said.
No cars on Water Street were hit and there do not appear to be any injuries, said Captain Scott Hamill of the Orange County Sheriffâ€™s office.
In all, 16 cars plus the engine came off the tracks, said Hamill. The locomotive was pulling a total of 77 freight cars, and 38 of those had cargo, said Doolittle.
The incident happened near a fuel storage area, but Hamill said the train did not come in contact with it.
